techmeme.title: Sources: Palantir is helping DOGE build an API layer above all IRS databases; DOGE wants Palantir's Foundry software to be the "read center of all IRS systems" (Makena Kelly/Wired)
Google says some terms in AI Overviews will link to Google's search results "to help people more easily explore topics and discover relevant websites" (Barry Schwartz/Search Engine Land)
Bain Capital agrees to buy Blackstone-backed HealthEdge, which offers SaaS for health insurers to modernize their systems, sources say for ~$2.6B including debt (Financial Times)
Sources: Binance asked the US Treasury last month to loosen oversight on its AML compliance, after Binance entered into deal talks with Trump's crypto venture (Wall Street Journal)
Source: Alphabet and Nvidia are among investors backing Safe Superintelligence; Google Cloud announced on April 9 that SSI is using its TPUs for AI research (Reuters)
